result.execSummary:
The defendant China L Cleghorn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

30 hours of communty service to be completed by 03-23-2017.

records.addlTxt:
Petitioner appeared, pro se.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney William Dockry
Deputy Court Clerk: nm
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and petitioner.  Court denies petition with prejudice.
Return of property hearing on December 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work with electronic monitoring.   REPORT DATE 09-28-2015 BY 09:00 am.

COURT ORDERED FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees on or before 03-23-2017.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  30 hours of communty service to be completed by 03-23-2017.
 Court will consider expungment if Defendant sucessfully completes all conditions of the Court's orders with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Received and filed with court:
*  Sentencing Referral Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Letter from Cintas
*  Letter from Orthopaedic Hospital

Defendant China L Cleghorn in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant China L Cleghorn in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant China L Cleghorn in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests another pretrial conference date.  Parties are notified that effective June 8, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Reserve Judge, Branch 45 in Courthouse room 515.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant China L Cleghorn in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant went to Public Defender's Office and is now eligible.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
3/5/15 $100 bail was returned to surety as "No Prosecution".
$500.00 bail to be returned. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 04-23-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for China L Cleghorn
Current: 3035 North 52nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 03-26-2015)
Prior: 3035 North 52nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Defendant China L Cleghorn in court.  Ann R. LÃ³pez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br.46.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/26/15 @ 1:30 pm
